009package PointOperations;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
013import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
014import ij.process.Blitter;
015import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
016import imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils;
017
018/**
019 * This plugin demonstrates alpha blending between two images:
020 * imBG: the background image (passed to and modified by the run method),
021 * imFG: the foreground image (selected in a user dialog).
022 * New (simpler) version using the {@code imagingbook.lib.ij.IjUtils.getOpenImages} library method.
023 * 
024 * @author WB
025 * @version 2022/04/01
026 */
027public class Linear_Blending implements PlugInFilter {
028        
029        private static double alpha = 0.5;      // transparency of foreground image
030        private ImagePlus imFG = null;          // foreground image (to be selected)
031        
032        @Override
033        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus imBG) {
034                return DOES_8G;
035        }       
036        
037        @Override
038        public void run(ImageProcessor ipBG) {  // ipBG = background image
039                if(!runDialog() || imFG == null) {
040                        return;
041                }
042                ImageProcessor ipFG = imFG.getProcessor().convertToByte(false);
043                ipFG = ipFG.duplicate();
044                ipFG.multiply(1 - alpha);
045                ipBG.multiply(alpha);
046                ipBG.copyBits(ipFG, 0, 0, Blitter.ADD);
047        }       
048
049        boolean runDialog() {
050                // get list of open images and their titles:
051                ImagePlus[] images = IjUtils.getOpenImages(true);
052                String[] titles = new String[images.length];
053                for (int i = 0; i < images.length; i++) {
054                        titles[i] = images[i].getShortTitle();
055                }
056                // create the dialog and show:
057                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());
058                gd.addChoice("Foreground image:", titles, titles[0]);
059                gd.addNumericField("Alpha value (0,..,1)", alpha, 2);
060                
061                gd.showDialog(); 
062                if (gd.wasCanceled()) {
063                        return false;
064                }
065
066                imFG = images[gd.getNextChoiceIndex()];
067                alpha = gd.getNextNumber();
068                return true;
069        }
070}
